adventures.name: Camp at Timberline
adventures.description: Oregon’s trails are ready when you are, whether you want to camp in one of our beautiful State Parks or backpack to a remote location.
adventures.gear: Gear: Tent, sleeping bag, dry wood, matches

adventures.name: Kayak the Sandy River
adventures.description: Oregon is home to calm and clear alpine ponds perfect for gentle paddles, and Class III and IV rapids ideal for thrilling whitewater adventures. So grab a paddle and join us on the water.
adventures.gear: Gear: River sandals, swimsuit, kayak & paddles, life vest

adventures.name: Snowshoe Mt Hood
adventures.description: Choose your own pace through beautiful tree-lined corridors and around sparkling blue lakes. We'll bring the hot chocolate.
adventures.gear: Gear: Puffy jacket, beanie, hand warmers, snowshoes

adventures.name: Alvord Desert
adventures.description: From the snow-capped Steens Mountain to the steamy hot springs to the sun-dried, cracked desert floor, you have to comve check out this desert oasis!

adventures.name: The Coast
adventures.description: 363 miles of stunning public coastline dotted with lighthouses, fishing villages and dramatic scenery. Your thoughts will fade away along this wind-swept shoreline.

adventures.name: Waterfalls
adventures.description: We have more than our fair share of waterfalls, hundreds actually, many of which are taller than skyscrapers and last year-round. With so many amazing waterfalls, we just can’t help but go chasing them.
adventures.gear: Gear: Hiking shoes, compass, first-aid kit
